turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'd like to schedule an appointment with Dr. Ramirez. I need to be seen sometime next week, preferably in the afternoon.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I can help you with that. Let me check Dr. Ramirez's availability for next week. Just one moment...

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Great, thanks. This is for a check-up, by the way. I probably should have mentioned that upfront. Ugh, I always forget something.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright. It looks like Dr. Ramirez has an opening on Tuesday at 2:30 PM and Thursday at 1:00 PM. Would either of those times work for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, neither of those are ideal, but the Tuesday one is probably better. But quick question, is it possible to know *why* there are so few afternoon appointments available? It always seems to be an issue.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. The availability of afternoon appointments is limited due to Dr. Ramirez's schedule which includes administrative duties and hospital rounds. However, Tuesday at 2:30 PM is confirmed. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I guess that makes sense. No, I think that's everything. Thanks for your help!
